alert.note: Alert for Kennebec; Knox; Lincoln; Sagadahoc; Waldo; York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 9:58AM EST until January 11 at 7:30AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Maine, including the following counties, in south central Maine, Kennebec, Knox, Lincoln, Sagadahoc and Waldo. In southwest Maine, Androscoggin, Cumberland and York. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 956 AM EST, Runoff and snowmelt continue after 1 and 3 inches of rain fell overnight. - Impacts will be worse near the coast where high tides have backed up streams. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Portland, Lewiston, Rochester, South Portland, Auburn, Biddeford, Brunswick, Augusta, Westbrook and Kittery.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Kennebec; Knox; Lincoln; Sagadahoc; Waldo; York
